column4: How do I slow down the gnome menus? They open too fast, they look like they are flickering, I would like them to slide open if possible.
Anyway to slow down the menus in gnome?
You can't get them to slide, but you can get them to fade
: You lost me, say that again
Either XGL (all of those fancy, wobbly window things) or just composite (an extension to X, letting you have shadows and fades)
I don't know of a guide for composite, I would have to walk you through it, but there is one for XGL if you choose that route
: Seems a little difficult, and untested, isnt there an easier way?
XGL is a little unstable, but Composite is easier
First install xcompmgr ("sudo apt-get install xcompmgr")
Rubbish? Dunno, change the preferences (and maybe install ms truetype fonts)
There is a package in multiverse I think
I actually use a font called Comic Book, but you probably won't want that :)
Are you sure it is enabled? Look in Settings>Repositories, select the Dapper repo and click edit. Make sure multiverse is ticked and reload
